vignette.name: The Object Explorer Toolbar
vignette.bodytext: The toolbar located at the bottom of the Object Explorer lets you set the behavior of the Explorer. The first four buttons provide options to control the Object Explorer window itself, while the next three are sensitive to what object is currently selected (If no object is selected, the icons are disabled).
The Explorer Settings button sets Object Explorer user preferences.
The View by Icon and View by Name buttons toggle between two different views of objects in the Object Explorer. If you like to remember objects visually, you can view by icon. rather than name.

The Hide Object Details button sets hide or show the Object Details portion of the Object Explorer. If object details are hidden, click on the Show Object Details button to display a short description of the selected object and additional links to documentation. If the Object Details panel is hidden, the Explorer will display a larger number of object categories.
The + button will place a copy of the selected Max object at the center of your Patcher Window.
The ? button will display the Max help file for the selected object.
The Reference button will open the Reference file for the selected object.
You can set preferences that control the conditions under which the Object Explorer appears and how it behaves to improve your personal patching experience.

ul.li: The Create Object Box Before Showing Explorer option gives experienced Max users the benefit of quick access to the Object Explorer without it 'getting the way' On double-click, a new object is created and you can continue typing the object name and text competition will assist you. Double-click or drag an object from the Object Explorer to override the newobject creation.

If Hide Explorer After Creating Object is enabled, the Object Explorer window will disappear after object creation. The Object Explorer will remain visible when objects are dragged from it, regardless of the state of this option. This option is disabled when the sidebar is open.

The Show Explorer Below Target option positions the Object Explorer window right below where you clicked so you don't have to mouse across your screen. This is particularly handy if you've set the Object Explorer to hide after creating an object (Normally, Max remembers where you placed the Object Explorer).
The Make Icons Larger and Make Icons Smaller menu options scale the icon size. This option is disabled if the Object Explorer is set to 'View by Name'

Click on the Explorer Settings button in the Object Explorer toolbar to show the menu options and choose an option from the menu you wish to set or disable. The enabled state of a menu item is shown by a check mark next to the item.
